dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lonely, rundown Victorian farmhouse surrounded by six-f high cornfields. A neglected barn in the distance. No neighbors in sight. Everything dark but for a flickering blue TV light from a upstairs window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS an array of framed photographs on a hallway wa stretching back generations - A recent color photo of a young man and woman on their we day. Sepia portraits of a homesteader family on the plain Kansas, everyone sturdy, solemn. Black & white portraits the '20's and '30s, lots of kids.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: The woman in the color photo - TORI BREYER, early 30's, i sleeveless nightgown - studies herself in the mirror. She doesn't like what she sees. Too plain. Too Midwestern wholesome. So she tucks a lock of hair behind her ear. Unbuttons a couple buttons on her nightgown. She makes her way -

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Her husband KYLE - 30's, thatchy beard, sturdy build - li bed scrolling around on his laptop. A TV plays a sitcom o Nick at Nite. Tori goes to Kyle. She gets on the bed, folds up his lapt sets them on a stack of books on the nightstand: Taking C of Your Fertility; The Everything Getting Pregnant Book; Miscarriage: Women Sharing From the Heart. Tori climbs on top of Kyle. Starts to kiss him. He's pleasantly surprised -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What's going on? Are you ovulating?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (between kisses) No. But for once let's not have it be work. Just fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, it's always fun for me. He gets into it. They start messing around. Close. Intima tangle of hands and limbs. A bedside lamp flickers. The cable TV feed pixillates and stutters - jagged bursts of creepy sitcom laughter. Tori stops short.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Um... Ow.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (hyper-concerned) What, what? Her hair has become caught in his watchband. They both gi

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, I'm sorry... He delicately maneuvers his wrist, unclips his watch, disentangles her hair. He throws his watch on the bed. She sits up, straddling his waist, her fingers interlaced his. He smiles. She smiles back at him. Then - A chain on the bedside lamp quivers, tinkling against the light fixture. Tori climbs off the bed. She's curious. Alert. As if the is suddenly charged. She ventures toward the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Babe? You okay? She looks down the dark hallway. Peering into the stillne She turns to Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I'm fine. For a second I thought -

dialogues.speaker: THEN PLUMMET.
dialogues.text: The TV crashes to the floor. Kyle's watch lands beside hi Tori and Kyle try to collect themselves.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You all right? She nods, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I don't know, an earthquake? She gives him a withering glance. THAT was not an earthqu She notices something outside. She drifts toward the bedr window and looks out, disturbed. Kyle joins her. They see, far off, a FLICKERING LIGHT in the woods. A thi wisp of smoke rising into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights cut through a dirt road - deeper and deeper in woods thick with trees. Kyle at the wheel, Tori looking out the window. She wears red wool cardigan over her nightgown. Eerie old-time musi plays on a tinny dashboard radio. As they drive, the headlights cast ominous shadows. The surroundings become more atmospheric and foreboding. Kyle senses Tori's anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You know, we don't have to do this. Tori shrugs him off. She doesn't want to do this, but she has to. A SCREECH OF BIRDS flee from the forest. Kyle and Tori look up as an endless FLOCK OF CROWS surges overhead.  Kyle watches them pass: why are they all leaving? The song on the radio starts to garble and short out. Kyl fiddles with the radio knobs, the dashboard lights flicke

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDSHIELD CRACKED.
dialogues.text: Kyle LOSES CONTROL OF THE TRUCK. He wrestles with the whe the vehicle SKIDS OFF THE DIRT ROAD - AND NOSEDIVES INTO A SHALLOW DITCH, jolting Kyle and Tori The truck whinnies to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamnit. Kyle and Tori climb out of the car. As he examines the da buckled hood, broken windshield - Tori stands cold and frightened. She can hear, faintly, far off - RASPY BREATHING - labore like a handsaw's back-and-forth.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Do you hear that? As he grabs a flashlight from the bed of the truck -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Hear what? He shines a flashlight on the jacked-up front hood. He's happy.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, that's beautiful. My truck just got wrecked by a fucking crow. There's no response. He looks around and notices Tori wandering deeper into the woods - as if called.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tori? She disappears into the brush.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? He heads after her, raking his flashlight across the wood  He notices trees snapped, shorn off, the edges of their branches ON FIRE. Tiny embers wafting through the air. Th BREATHING getting louder. Kyle - disoriented - spots a glimpse of Tori's nightgown fluttering past some trees. He scrambles to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tori... He sees her, briefly, just before she goes through some bushes, deeper into the woods. Kyle hurries to reach her. He shines the flashlight onto the ground and realizes he' a SMOLDERING TRENCH. A SHADOWY FIGURE APPROACHES behind him. He turns - shines flashlight - IT's TORI! Kyle is rattled. Tori is overcome with emotion. Almost beaming. She takes Kyle's hand, pulling at him, beckoning him deep into the forest. The RASPY BREATHING grows louder. A loom sense of dread. She leads him to a JUMBLE OF WRECKAGE SURROUNDED BY FLAME

dialogues.speaker: RUPTURED OPEN.
dialogues.text: She reaches into the pod and takes out -

dialogues.speaker: A NEWBORN
dialogues.text: Kyle staggers back -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus! What the fuck! Tori cradles the wheezing baby. He's no more than three pounds. Fragile in her hands. Helpless.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: It's a child. A boy.  6. Kyle frets as Tori holds the baby to her. The baby stares at Tori, needing her. Tori removes her cardigan and wraps around the child for warmth. Kyle stands back as Tori cradles the baby to her. The bab stares up at Tori, needing her. Tori removes her cardigan wraps it around the child for warmth.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Where'd it come from?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: We gotta call someone. The sheriff, child services, I don't know. Tori is lost in the newborn child. She strokes his scalp. breathing slows, steadies. Kyle steps toward Tori and the baby, mystified.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What should we do with him?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Take care of him. Kyle squirms, uncertain -—

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Tori... Tori - welling with emotion - looks up at her husband.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: We've been trying for a baby for so many years. All that pain, all that agony and heartache. The memory stabs at Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I know, I know...

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: All those nights we stayed up holding each other, wishing - praying - that God or the Universe or someone would help us. And now it's happened. He's here. A gift. Meant for us.  Blue (11/30/17) 7. Kyle is awed, caught up in something larger than himself. holds out his pinkie. The baby grasps it. Tori smiles. She kisses the baby's forehead. The family is together, complete, flames and smoldering s behind them. Tori and Kyle look down at the peaceful baby her arms.

dialogues.speaker: YEARS LATER.
dialogues.text: A crisp autumn morning. Tori walks through sprawling farm She calls out -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin! Time for school! No reply. She lets out a two-tone SING-SONG WHISTLE. From some other part of the property she hears the same S SONG WHISTLE in reply. She smiles to herself. She walks across an expanse of patchy grass and heads tow an ABANDONED BARN. She playfully whistles again. From inside the barn, someone whistles back. Tori opens a dilapidated door. Barn swallows SCREECH - STARTLING HER - flying past her face. She watches the bir soar through sunlight filtering through old rotting windo and roof beams. She climbs up a ladder to an upper loft area, scanning th nooks and crevices - a game of hide and seek. She lets out a whistle. Elsewhere, closer now - the whist replies. She thinks she hears a creak from one of the floor boards She smiles, climbs down into a grain pit area - BENJAMIN leaps from some higher level and tackles Tori on moldering mess of hay.  Blue (11/30/17) 8. Tori winces, laughing -

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're getting too big for this game! Tori stares into Benjamin's eyes. He's gangly, 11 going o hair uncombed, his eyes alert.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you'll always be my baby boy. Benjamin smiles. He rises and lifts Tori to her feet -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Took you long enough to find me. Kyle - wearing jeans, work gloves in his hand, fresh from fields - enters the barn. He's got a noticeable limp.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What are you guys doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I was just hiding and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: C'mon, you know the barn is off limits. Kyle double-checks the padlock on a hinged trap door buil into the floor of the grain pit area.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All these loose boards and nails and shit, I just don't want you to break your neck.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: He knows that. We were about to leave. Kyle puts his arm around his son -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Sorry if I gotta be the big bad Dad now and again... Benjamin rolls his eyes. The family heads out of the barn the vast farmland and the morning light. PUSH IN on the trap door in the barn, giving off a FAINT, THROBBING HUM. INSISTENT. FOREBODING.  Blue (11/30/17) 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCIENCE TEACHER stands next to a video projection - ima of bees and wasp dance off of her in the darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER
dialogues.text: Wasps and bees. Both members of the same insect family, both with two pairs of wings, both with stingers. As the teacher lectures, a pretty girl with frizzy hair - CAITLYN - peers over at Benjamin making childlike doodles his notebook - variations on his name and initials. SCIENCE TEACHER (CONT’D) Can anyone tell me any differences between them? Mr. Breyer? Benjamin looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Well, um... bees are pollinators, wasps are predators.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER
dialogues.text: Good, good.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Wasps are more aggressive. More dangerous. One species, Polistes sulcifer, is what's called a brood parasite. A blue-eyed boy, ROYCE, exchanges glances with a kid with FAUXHAWK, the two of them stifling a snicker. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) These wasps have lost the ability to build their own nests, so they use brute force to get other wasp species to raise their young. They make them feed their babies beetle larvae and maggots. An awkward silence from the class. Royce pipes up -

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: Yo man, how'd they taste? The classroom ERUPTS in laughter. Benjamin is bruised. As the teacher tries to quiet the class, Caitlyn leans ov Benjamin and whispers -  10.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLYN
dialogues.text: Don't worry about that idiot. Some day he'll be working for you. Benjamin takes this in. Caitlyn returns to her notebook. smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori washes dishes in the sink, steam rising. The kitchen off dining and living rooms that haven't changed in gener - peeling wallpaper, heavy dark furniture, old porcelain A LOUD THUMP from upstairs. Tori turns off the sink. Listens. She calls upstairs -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Ben? A grandfather clock TICK-TOCKS. Then, from somewhere in the house, she hears - A LOW MURMURING NOISE. GHASTLY. SINISTER. Tori is creeped. She makes her way toward a back STUDY off the living room Kyle is slumped on an old couch, sleeping, the TV playing old movie with the sound off. Tori whispers -

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kyle, do you hear that? He mumbles incoherently. She returns to the living room. She hears a SMALL CLATTER outside - trash cans maybe. Then a PAINED GUTTURAL MOAN. She opens the back screen door and goes -  Blue (11/30/17) 11.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE FARMHOUSE
dialogues.text: A jagged breeze. Wind chimes trill. Tori stands on a wraparound porch. She scans the backyard area. Bare light bulb behind her. fields a blanket of darkness. She zeroes in on a rusty swing CREAKING BACK AND FORTH. Is that what she heard? Then, across the yard, SOMEONE WALKS THROUGH HER PERIPHER VISION. Tori jolts as she watches BENJAMIN BEE-LINE INTO THE BACK OBLIVIOUS TO TORI, OBLIVIOUS TO EVERYTHING, in a kind of zombie trance. It's chilling. Unsettling.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin? He keeps walking through fluttering sheets on the clothes Through the backyard. Past the coop - chickens SQUAWKING WILDLY.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Benjamin! Tori follows Benjamin as he staggers toward the barn - a figure in his pajamas receding into the vast darkness. Tori can make out an eerie RINGING NOISE - keening, pulsa emanating from inside the barn. Faintly at first, then growing. Tori heads toward the source of the noise. She enters -

dialogues.speaker: THE BARN
dialogues.text: Almost pitch black. Scary as hell. Tori trying to find Benjamin in the shadows. The ringing noise beckoning him. She FINDS HIM IN THE GRAIN PIT AREA, THE TRAP DOOR IN THE FLOOR OPEN, PEERING INSIDE. Down in the pit is the BLACK POD HE ARRIVED IN AS A BABY. shell is putrefying. Crawling with carrion beetles. It THROBS, KEENING.  Blue (11/30/17) 12. Benjamin stands over it - MURMURING IN SOME HUSHED ALIEN GIBBERISH -— He reaches out to the pod. He MAKES CONTACT WITH IT, the keening growing LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin. Benjamin turns - startled - his hand grazing the metallic of the pod. The keening noise STOPS. Benjamin clutches his hand in pain. He's disoriented. Wea Lost.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: What happened? Tori supports Benjamin. She examines his injured hand. A TRICKLE OF BLOOD runs from his finger.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It cut me.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry, baby. Tori uses her shirt to squeeze Benjamin's fingers, stanch the bleeding, her shirt now blotted with blood.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (in a daze) I heard... I don't know what it was. Voices or something. Tori looks into his eyes, searching, trying to figure out much to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You were dreaming. She soothes Benjamin's hair.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's forget this happened, okay? Tori holds Benjamin, comforting him, trying to be strong, deep down she's frightened, a sense of something new and terrifying welling up inside of her.  Blue (11/30/17) 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark and shadowy, cluttered with the detritus different eras: a radiator from the 1910's, cowboy wallpa from the '40s. Tori lovingly tucks Benjamin into bed. She makes sure he's asleep. Kisses his forehead. She heads out of his room, closing the CREAKING DOOR slow careful not to make too much noise. She turns, and -—

dialogues.speaker: KYLE IS BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: She jumps, startled.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Everything okay? She fidgets.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I don't know. He was... sleepwalking I guess.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Where? Tori catches herself, decides to protect Kyle -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Downstairs. He's fine. C'mon, you got an early morning.

dialogues.speaker: GROWLING ENGINES.
dialogues.text: First-person video POV of stock cars racing around a trac crashing into each other. Benjamin and Tori sit side-by-side at the wheels of a NAS Racing arcade game. Tori is having a blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three members of a wait staff CLAP IN TIME WHILE CHANTING BIRTHDAY TUNE. We're in a casual dining place. The waiter down a sundae with a lit candle in front of Benjamin -  14.

dialogues.speaker: WAIT STAFF
dialogues.text: Happy happy birthday! We whipped up something cold! Benjamin is moody, distant. He's surrounded by Kyle, Tori AUNT MERILEE - 30's, sunny - and his UNCLE NOAH - late 30 pudgy, affable. Benjamin contorts his face, turned off by the cheery song WAIT STAFF (CONT’D) Happy happy birthday! For someone getting old! Tori snaps a photo with her phone as Benjamin blows out t candle. The staff whoops it up, wishes him happy birthday then heads off.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Wow. I think they use that to break prisoners at Guantanamo. Benjamin half-smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Sorry, I did not know they were gonna do that. Noah puts his arm around Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Was it punishment for something? Bad grades?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (proudly) You've heard about his test scores, right? Top one percent.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Top one-tenth of one percent. Everyone on the faculty has been talking about him.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: And he's just getting started. She starts to get choked up.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So much ahead of you.  15.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Well, a boy that special deserves a special gift. This is from me and your Aunt Merilee. He hands Benjamin a long wrapped gift. Merilee

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Go ‘head. Benjamin tears off the wrapping to reveal a REMINGTON BOL ACTION RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Shot my first buck with that very same model.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No. No way. Tori, we discussed this.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I know, but -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (to Benjamin) You're not ready. Kyle takes the rifle from him. Benjamin flares with anger

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I'm twelve years old.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Exactly. You're still a child. Benjamin is irate. He stares down Kyle. Arcade games malfunction in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Give that to me. It's mine.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (taken aback) What'd you say to me?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I_said - give it to me. Tori and Kyle are stunned. They've never seen this behavi from Benjamin before. Benjamin glares at his Dad -  Blue (11/30/17) 16.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (furious) Okay. You're done. No ice cream. Kyle knocks the sundae aside - the glass bowl clattering across the table. Other customers steal glances at them.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're leaving. Kyle stands to go, grabbing Benjamin by the elbow - Benjamin doesn't budge. An immovable force. Kyle is about to lose it -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get _up. Benjamin boils. It's a standoff. Tori tenderly touches Benjamin's arm.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin... Listen to your father. Benjamin looks at his mom. A moment passes between them. Benjamin gives in. He rises to go.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Merilee and Noah) I'm so sorry, guys. Merilee and Noah beg off: not our business. Tori and Kyle leave with Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori sits on a couch, removes her shoes, rubs her feet. K gets a longneck from the fridge, pops the cap.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Turns twelve years old, suddenly gets a mouth on him.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: It was so strange. So unlike him.  Blue (11/30/17) 17. Kyle limps toward the living room, thinks he notices some outside - glances out a window behind Tori. He sees wind blowing through the trees, spindly shadows on the yard -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe just the wind.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I worry about him. Getting older. Changing. Maybe it's all normal, I don't know. Kyle sits next to Tori. Takes a swig from his beer.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Oh, we were so much worse when we were his age. The shit we got into? Sneaking out on school nights, smoking weed in my parents' basement... Kyle twinkles at the memory -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Fucking around on that puke-green couch down there. Every time the floor would creak upstairs I'd zip my damn pants up... They laugh as he nuzzles up to her, puts his hand on her thigh. She returns his affection.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We were such idiots. But we pulled through, didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Barely. Your parents were okay I guess. Mine sucked. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just want us to be better than that. Kyle ruminates. The large window above them, trees waveri outside, scraping the glass.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: How 'bout we all go camping up in Drywood this weekend? The three of us.  Blue (11/30/17) 18.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Oo - we haven't done that in forever. She happily climbs on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Know what else we haven't done in forever? She smiles as they start kissing.

dialogues.speaker: CRRREEEEEEEECHCH
dialogues.text: A RICKETY AUTOMATIC DOOR OPENS on a garage packed with bo gardening tools, a 1970's sedan, its hood stacked with pa cans. Kyle carries the the Remington rifle from his truck into garage. The wind chimes jangle. He climbs on a work bench He reaches above a cabinet, moves aside Christmas lights mason jars filled with nails. Goes to PLACE THE RIFLE on of the cabinet - The light bulb in the garage flickers and dims. Kyle stops. He hears, from outside, A LOW MURMURING NOISE GHASTLY. SINISTER. The same noise Tori heard from Benjami He listens. He can make out the FLUTTER AND SQUAWK of chickens - Rising into a CACOPHONY OF PANICKED SCREECHES, FLESH TEAR punctuated by a PAINED GUTTURAL MOAN. Then - silence. Nothing but the wind chimes. Kyle climbs down from the work bench with the rifle. He grabs two bullets from a box on a shelf, opens the cha of the rifle, presses them in. He slides the bolt shut wi CLICK. He ventures out into the yard, toward the chicken coop, r leading the way into the darkness.  Blue (11/30/17) 19. He treads lightly, past the squeaking swing set, planning sneak up on whatever got to the chickens. He hears a dripping near a tall tree. He limps toward it. stops to listen. DROPS OF BLOOD fall onto his face. He wipes at his face, his hand slick with blood. What the hell? He looks up - There's a MANGLED CHICKEN CARCASS lodged in the branches. He walks further and discovers - A few more CHICKEN CARCASSES scattered throughout the property, torn open, entrails smeared along the ground. Then - A RUSTLING FROM THE CORNFIELD. Kyle spins. SOMETHING'S IN THERE. WHISPERING STRANGE NOISES - a kind of ALIEN GIBBERISH. Kyle steadies his rifle. He HEADS INTO THE DARK CORNFIELD. He uses the barrel of the rifle to nudge aside leafy corn stalks. His heart is pounding. His breath shallow. His footsteps CRUNCHING dry leaves. He can see SPLATTERS OF BLOOD on the leaves of corn. He goes deeper into the cornfield. Now almost engulfed by stalks. He can barely see a foot in front of him. He comes out on an empty space between the rows of corn. All is silent. He listens for the intruder. Then -

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING BLEATS AT KYLE FROM HIS SIDE
dialogues.text: Kyle SPINS WITH THE RIFLE -  Blue (11/30/17) 20. He relaxes. It's a HORRIBLY WOUNDED CHICKEN, one wing rip off, a chunk of flesh missing, squawking in agony, stumbl in circles. Kyle aims the rifle point blank at the thing and FIRES, putting it out of its misery. The shot echoes miles away. Kyle stands in the cornfield with his rifle. He calls out the darkness -—

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, wolf! I outrank you on the food chain! You come round again, I'll kill your ass! No reply. Kyle is alone amid a vast sea of corn stalks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin heads toward the truck, where Kyle packs camping supplies. He wears a t-shirt, a backpack over his shoulde He seems more inward, more distant, than he did earlier. Tori calls out from a wraparound porch -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin, where's your jacket?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I don't need one.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: It's 40 degrees! Benjamin slumps his shoulders and sulks.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine, I'll get it. She goes -

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE FARMHOUSE
dialogues.text: Through the kitchen and living room. She hastens upstairs. Into -  Blue (11/30/17) 21.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Tori sifts through the clutter, looking for Benjamin's ja She spots it thrown by his bed. She crouches down and not between the mattress and box spring a SHEAF OF CRINKLED PAPERS. She takes them out and pages through them. From downstairs, Kyle calls -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hon? You about ready? Tori is lost in the pages. Concerned. Kyle joins her in the room.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You find it?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I found... something. She hands him the pages. On top is a Target ad featuring models in bikinis. Kyle is amused -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Is this his idea of porn? He sees a Memorial Day Sale mailer with women in bras. He amused -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mailers from Target - for the truly hardcore. He leafs through and finds PAGES FROM AN ANATOMY TEXTBOOK Medical diagrams of the FEMALE REPRODUCTIVE SYSTEM. An illustration of a NAKED FEMALE and her endocrine system. SECTIONS OF THE VAGINA, THE CERVIX, THE UTERUS.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Is it just a guy thing?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Not any guy I know. Not this.  Blue (11/30/17) 22.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time you had a talk with him. You know, birds, bees, et cetera. Kyle sighs. He doesn't want to.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll give him the same talk my dad gave me: ‘It's the second hole from the back of the neck.'

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Ugh. She swats at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crisp afternoon, sun dead over the horizon. A cheap dom tent set up at a campsite. Tori takes a couple of gnarled steaks from a package and salts them. Up the hillside, Kyle and Benjamin crinkle through brown leaves, gathering firewood. Kyle tries to be casual -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: So, uh, Ben... I know you just had your birthday.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Which means you're a young man, your body's starting to change.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: So you might find yourself more and more interested in women. And women's bodies. Benjamin looks up at Kyle - cold, upset -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Were you in my room?  Blue (11/30/17) 23.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What? No.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I don't like it when people go through my private stuff.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Look, I respect that. I was the same way at your age - I thought about girls all the time, and no one ever told me it was okay to touch it or play with it.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You know. The, uh - my penis.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: But here's the thing: sex isn't about organs and body parts. I mean, it is. But it's really about finding the right person, falling in love.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: And making babies.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Eventually. Even then, that's not the only purpose of sex. Your mother and I, we still - you know, partake. And she can't have babies. Benjamin is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: That's why we went to an adoption agency.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Mom can't have children? Like no matter what? Benjamin chews his fingernails, simmering. He looks at To seeming betrayed. Kyle is baffled.  Blue (11/30/17) 24.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What's this about? Were you wanting a baby brother or sister? Because we're happy with you. With the three of us.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: That's not it. Kyle gets close to Benjamin, tries to connect with him -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Look, maybe my words came out stupid. Just know that you're a guy, and you're gonna be feeling certain urges about girls you see in movies, girls in your class, whatever. It's okay to give into them now and again. Benjamin looks up at Kyle. He nods, placated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin's classmate Caitlyn lies on her comforter in paj bottoms and a t-shirt, talking on her phone, her frizzy h dangling over the foot of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLYN
dialogues.text: Okay... Jesus, I'm at, like, zero percent, so I should probably go. Caitlyn rises and crosses toward her desk. She passes her second-story window and doesn't see - outside - A BLURRY FIGURE IN HER YARD, WATCHING HER. CAITLYN (CONT’D) (on her phone, laughing) Same to you, dork. Mwah. She hangs up her phone and sets it on her desk. She plugs into her charger. Her home screen blinks weirdly and goes dead. Probably out of battery. Caitlyn turns off her ligh She passes her window again. This time the figure is CLOS SOMEHOW RIGHT OUTSIDE HER WINDOW - HOVERING. Caitlyn plops into her bed, throws covers over herself. We see, behind Caitlyn - HER WINDOW IS OPEN. The LONG CUR FLUTTERING LIGHTLY. Caitlyn nestles into her pillow. She closes her eyes.  25. Everything calm and quiet. Then she hears - EERIE MUSIC PLAYING. Something spooky and romantic, like Mazzy Star. Caitlyn is terrified. She lifts her head and sees - Her laptop is OPEN, GLOWING. The song playing on iTunes. She gets out of bed. She approaches her computer, confused. No one in sight. S shuts the laptop. The music stops. She turns around to head to bed. THE MUSIC PLAYS AGAIN BEHIND HER. Caitlyn sees her laptop open again. Her heart rate quicke She's almost shaking with fear. She slams the laptop shut. She stacks heavy books on the Her room now silent. She notices the accordion doors on her closet SLIGHTLY AJ She slowly advances toward it. She reaches out to the knob of the door... She grasps it and - SLOWLY SLIDES THE ACCORDION DOORS. They SQUEAK open. The closet is pitch black. Caitlyn reaches up, pulls a chain, and turns on a bare li bulb. Just clothes on hangars. Shoe boxes. Piles of old toys an board games. Caitlyn steels herself and - QUICKLY PARTS THE CLOTHES ON HANGARS — Just a plain wall behind the clothes. She parts more hangars. Then a couple more.  Blue (11/30/17) 26. Then parts another -

dialogues.speaker: A FACE GLARES AT HER
dialogues.text: She jumps back! It's just an old RAG DOLL with a torn-up face. Caitlyn lowers her guard. She turns off the closet light. Closes the door, turns, a - walks, oblivious, DIRECTLY PAST BENJAMIN STANDING BEHIN LONG FLUTTERING CURTAINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hair on her neck raises. She senses something awful a terrifying - She sees BENJAMIN STARING AT HER, CURTAINS SWIRLING AROUN IN THE NIGHT AIR. CAITLYN LETS OUT A BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAM. She TURNS TO RUN OUT OF HER ROOM. The door SWINGS OPEN -

dialogues.speaker: IN HER ARMS.
dialogues.text: It's her mom, ERICA. Caitlyn is crying.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: What's wrong? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CAITLYN
dialogues.text: Someone's there! By the curtains! Erica flips on the LIGHTS. She approaches the windows - Slowly. Cautiously. She grasps the curtains - AND OPENS THEM. There's no one there. The window is closed. Nothing amiss Caitlyn is a wreck.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Honey, no one's here.  Blue (11/30/17) 27.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLYN
dialogues.text: He was right there. I think it was... this kid from my class. Erica is dubious.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Were you watching scary movies on your phone again?

dialogues.speaker: CAITLYN
dialogues.text: I wasn't, I swear. But even Caitlyn is starting to doubt herself. CAITLYN (CONT’D) Can I sleep in your bed tonight?

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Of course. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori STARTLES AWAKE. She's in a sleeping bag next to Kyle in their tent. She f at an empty sleeping bag - Benjamin is gone. The tent door is unzipped, flaps blowing in the breeze. J crickets and katydids outside.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin? Kyle wakes -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin - he's gone. The two of them scramble out of the tent. Kyle calls out

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Ben! In a panic she grabs a flashlight. Kyle starts to split f Tori -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You check that way, I'll take over here.  Blue (11/30/17) 28. Tori nods nervously and goes into the forest. She shines the flashlight everywhere. Acres of trees rece into total darkness. She's alone. She hears a FLUTTER somewhere in the trees, crow SQUAWKING. She looks behind her. No sign of Kyle. The embers of the campfire receding into the night. She's scared.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin, can you hear me?... Where are you, baby? Tori hears RUSTLING IN THE TREES ABOVE. Seeds and acorns dropping around her. She shines the flashlight up into the tall trees - vertig dizzying, casting eerie shadows. She thinks she sees SOME MOVING UP THERE.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Benjamin? Her flashlight starts to flicker and spasm. Tori rattles it, trying to jar the batteries back into pl The light goes back on. She shines it up. Nothing up ther She lowers the flashlight - BENJAMIN IS DIRECTLY BEHIND HER. Tori startles - then loosens.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Benjamin! Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Taking a pee. Tori lets out a huge laugh. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) Did I scare you? I didn't mean to.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (still laughing) No, it's just... You had me and your dad pretty freaked.  Blue (11/30/17) 29. She hugs her son.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm just glad you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school day is over. Benjamin is at the end of the wal in front of the school, apart from other kids, as he sits hunched over his notebook, wearing headphones and doodlin A ways back from him, Tori wears a Hy-Vee employee polo, with her sister Merilee, deep in conversation -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You don't think I should take him to someone? A professional maybe?

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: For what? Talking back to his dad and keeping weird jerk-off material under his mattress?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: It's more than that. Benjamin was always my special little guy. Such sweetness. But lately he's... different.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Uh - yeah, it's called puberty. Merilee laughs, but Tori is pensive. She wants to say mor

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, Benjamin is highly gifted. Kids like him are often anxious, depressed, they may have problems integrating socially. What appears troubling to you is actually normal for his age. He'll grow out of it.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I hear you. Maybe I'm overreacting. Merilee wraps Tori in a soothing hug, then breaks it off

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'm late for my 3 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Go.  Blue (11/30/17) 30. Merilee hustles off. Tori approaches Benjamin from behind. We can hear, muffle the same song that played in Caitlyn's bedroom. She peers over Benjamin's shoulder and sees what he's doo - VARIATIONS ON HIS INITIALS, LOTS OF STYLIZED B'S, next sketches of CAPES AND MASKS. Tori sees Benjamin obsessing over a CRUDE BALLPOINT DRAWI CAITLYN'S FACE with her frizzy hair, HER EYES WIDE AND FEARFUL. Tori zeroes in on the drawing - leaning in - closer -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN TURNS SUDDENLY, STARTLING HER. GLARING AT HIM. T
dialogues.text: is flustered.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Um... who is she? Benjamin closes his notebook shut. He storms into the par lot toward Tori's car.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry! She follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's cute, by the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle sits at an old desk in the study. Just a desk lamp o has his iPad and checkbook open, bills spread out before He picks up a certified letter from the local bank. Not g He tears it open. Scans the letter. We catch scraps of the letter -

dialogues.speaker: "NOTICE OF FORECLOSURE"
dialogues.text: ",..missed payments..." "Property to be sold within 90 days unless..." Kyle sets the letter down. He sits there, fuming - then, overcome, he crumples the letter. So angry he wants to crawl out of his skin.  Blue (11/30/17) 31. He looks through the open doorway and sees Tori fiddling a flickering light bulb. Kyle goes to the door and CLOSES IT quietly. He pulls up his pant leg and unstraps a plastic PROSTHESI an artificial leg from the knee down. He sighs, some pain relieved. He opens a bottom desk drawer. Reaches behind some hanging files, deep in back - And pulls out something bundled inside an old sock. He unfurls it to reveal a PILL BOTTLE OF OXYCONTIN. He twists off the cap, shakes out a couple of pink pills. He swallows the pills, sits back, and waits for them to c him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later in the evening, Kyle is in a fog - drooly, nearly p out. He hears a DIGITAL CHIME. Kyle perks up a bit. Orients himself. He looks down at the iPad on his desk. An ALERT from the security cam. Something moving outside. Kyle opens his home security app - He sees the EERIE BLACK-AND-WHITE NIGHT-VISION ON THE CHI COOP. All seems still. Then, suddenly, CLOSE UP OF WINGS FLAPPING, a fury of feathers. Chickens are dying. Kyle, creeped out, sees WHITE WISPS amid the chicken coop footage is jagged - freezing and skipping. He REWINDS the footage and freezes the frame. He sees what looks like a BLUR. Kyle is confused. He un-pauses the image. The footage plays. Kyle peers closer -  Blue (11/30/17) 32.

dialogues.speaker: A HAND JUTS INTO FRAME.
dialogues.text: Kyle can make out A WHITE FIGURE - GHOSTLY, BLURRY, WITH LUMINESCENT EYES. He's horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, holding the iPad, leads Tori down rickety wooden st

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Kyle! What is this about? They get to the bottom of the stairs. At one time an old cellar - stone walls, low ceiling - now a laundry room li a bare light bulb. Kyle - agitated, clammy - fidgets.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It was a person.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: What was?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I saw something in the chicken coop. Wasn't a wolf. Wasn't an animal. It was a person.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: A person?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (apologetic, emotional) Babe, I think it may've been Benjamin. She looks at him askance -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: No. He opens up the security cam footage on the iPad, presses play, and shows it to her.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: This is from the camera I put up.  Blue (11/30/17) 33. She hears the audio - fluttering and tearing - but THE VI IS PIXILLATED, CORRUPTED.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: There's nothing here. Kyle is confused. He takes the iPad back, tries to find t footage.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I don't know what's going on. There was someone. A hand. Tori slumps as he prattles on -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This was our fear. All along. Abnormal shit. Truly out-there shit. Tori stares at him pitifully.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see what I'm saying, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (solemn, direct) You're doing it again.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: The Oxy.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: That's... No. That's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You have that look in your eye, you're talking crazy -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No, I haven't - (catching himself) Tori, that's not what this is about. She gives him a withering stare.  Blue (11/30/17) 34.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: It would make a lot more sense that your new camera is broken than that our son magically killed a bunch of chickens. Kyle is chastened. Tori walks up the stairs. Kyle turns to the iPad. He presses play, sees only CORRUP DATA. The footage is a pixilated mishmash, almost taunting him. frustrated, defeated, wondering if he really is seeing th

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red-haired 12-YEAR-OLD GIRL stands with her hands folde across her chest, her eyes closed. She lets herself FREE FALL BACKWARD - into a circle of ot kids who pass her around, her eyes closed, a version of t trust game Willow in the Wind. Benjamin is on one side of the circle, Caitlyn on the oth He looks at her. She looks away, unsettled. A P.E. teacher blows his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER
dialogues.text: Okay now - there we go! When we trust each other, good things happen! He looks at Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're up next, big guy. Benjamin dutifully enters the middle of the circle.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's hear it for Benjamin! Some kids clap. Benjamin stands up straight, folds his ar across his chest. He looks back at his spotters.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nothing to be afraid of! Your classmates have your back - literally!  Blue (11/30/17) 35. Benjamin closes his eyes. He lets himself fall. Caitlyn watches, fearful, as kids PASS BENJAMIN around th circle. Someone passes him to Caitlyn. She steps aside and LETS H DROP. He SPRAWLS ONTO THE GYM FLOOR. The other kids ooh and win Royce laughs. Benjamin lies there, unmoving, SEETHING INS

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: Way to trust the floor, Breyer! The teacher rushes to Benjamin -

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER
dialogues.text: You okay, bud? He gingerly lifts Benjamin into a sitting position. Some students cringe, others giggle. Benjamin glares at Caitlyn.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn it, Caitlyn. Give him a hand up. Caitlyn is terrified to go near Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (warning) Caitlyn.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLYN
dialogues.text: He's a pervert. Royce and his buddy Fauxhawk laugh. Benjamin fumes. He st at Caitlyn.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You lie.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER
dialogues.text: Hold on now - we're all on the same team here. Caitlyn, help him up. Caitlyn hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help him up or you fail this class. Caitlyn squirms.  36. Then - She reluctantly reaches her hand down to Benjamin. Benjamin grasps her hand. HE SQUEEZES IT. TORRENTIAL PAIN hitting Caitlyn hard. Benjamin stays LOCKED IN ON HER. A fixed beam of rage.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Benjamin! Caitlyn lets out an ANIMAL WAIL OF PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let_go! Benjamin squeezes tighter. His grip like an industrial machine. THE BONES IN CAITLYN'S HAND SNAPPING. Then GROUND TO DUST The other kids PANIC - WHIMPERING - SCREAMING. Benjamin GRINDS HIS HAND INTO A FIST, then lets go. The P.E. Teacher rushes in to help Caitlyn - She falls back, bawling, clutching her wrist, HER HAND HA LOOSE, NOTHING BUT PULP - A BAGGY MONSTROSITY. The other kids SHRIEK. Benjamin's eyes brim with satisfaction. He's at peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand-held. We're moving - quickly. Kyle, drenched by rain rushes down the hall, toward an administrative office - Past students glancing at him, gossiping in hushed tones. Past a young female sheriff's deputy, walkie squawking. He approaches the sound of PEOPLE YELLING. He rounds a corner and enters a -  37.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: Tori - in her work polo - argues with Caitlyn's mom Erica CHIEF DEPUTY TOM DEEVER - 45, brawny, wearing a khaki she uniform - stands between them. A waif-thin PRINCIPAL is o the side.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Did you see my daughter's hand?! Did you see it?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I'm sorry she's in pain, Erica, but screaming at me is not going to make it any better. Kyle notices, in the glassed-in principal's office - Benj sitting alone, engrossed in doodling, his backpack next t him.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving until your son is removed from these premises -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Oh Christ....

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: - before he hurts someone else.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Can someone take a breath and tell me where things stand?

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: Benjamin is officially suspended for two days -

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Suspended? He should be arrested!

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: That's up to juvenile prosecutors.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: After his suspension he'll receive regular sessions with our school counselor, Miss Merilee.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: His aunt?  Blue (11/30/17) 38. Deever is

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: Right now she's the only -—

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: (to Deever) You know her son was inside my daughter's bedroom last Saturday night. taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Last Saturday night he was camping with us. Thirty miles away! Kyle glances at Benjamin, wondering if he was really with the entire night.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: (to Tori) You just can't admit there's something seriously fucked up with your kid.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Because he's adopted there's something wrong with him? That's - beyond disgusting. We're done here. Tori goes to get Benjamin. Erica badgers her -

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Who's his father? Some kind of serial killer? Tori escorts Benjamin out of the office. Benjamin passes and GLARES AT HER, DEAD-EYED, COLD. Deever positions himself in front of Erica, trying to cal down. Benjamin walks out with his parents, never breaking gaze at Erica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining outside - thunder GROANING. Tori changes out of h clothes. Kyle angrily removes his jacket -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: If I pulled shit like that, breaking a girl's hand? Goddamn. My daddy woulda beat my ass.  Blue (11/30/17) 39.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Like that's gonna help.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: We're probably on the hook now for all her fucking medical bills -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: This is what you care about right now?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I care about my family!

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Then start showing it.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: This is how I show it. By holding him accountable. Not by slathering him with love and telling him how damn exceptional he is.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: He is exceptional, Kyle. He is. The two of us were trying - forever - to have a child, then he arrives. This miracle.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (derisively) Yeah, his behavior has been so miraculous lately.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Ask Merilee - everything he's going through is normal for his age. Kyle levels his gaze at her -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Tori, he may look like us, but he's not us. He's never bled, not once in his whole life. Never had a cut. Or a broken bone. Or a bruise. And now he's hurting people. Erica was right - there is something fucked up about him. Tori simmers. Upset. Then -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: He does bleed.  Blue (11/30/17) 40. Kyle gives her a confused look.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He cut his hand, that night when he was sleepwalking.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Out in the barn. He found the pod. Kyle is stunned. Furious.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Why the fuck didn't you tell me?!

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Because I knew you'd react like this. You always, always thought he was something to hide, something to be ashamed of -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You_don't get to make decisions like that for me! He grabs his jacket, starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Out. Don't wait up. He hobbles out of the room and down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori sits at the dining room table, her laptop open befor her. She pops open a bottle of beer, takes a swig. She types into Google - childhood developmental disorders - and presses return. It yields a flurry of results - her scanning phrases for meaning, answers - Disruptive Mood Dysregulation Disorder... Encopresis... Oppositional Defiant Disorder... She goes to take another drink.  41. From upstairs she hears -— A LOUD THUD, like a body hitting the floor. She sets the drink down. Listens. She hears a MUFFLED UNEARTHLY MOAN. PAINED. ALMOST ANIMAL She leaps up and hastens -—

dialogues.speaker: UP THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: She heads down the hallway. Toward Benjamin's room. She can hear a SMALL RACKET from inside his room, like ob being thrown about. She tries the door but it's locked. She knocks.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin? She can make out the MUMBLED ALIEN GIBBERISH.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Open the door - please. She bangs on the door with the palm of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBERISH.
dialogues.text: Tori - panicking - BANGS HARDER ON THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Benjamin!

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN GROANING
dialogues.text: Tori leans her shoulder into the door and BUSTS IT OPEN -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (11/30/17) 42. TORI SCRAMBLES ONTO THE BED -— SHE PULLS DOWN BENJAMIN. FIGHTING WITH THE VIOLENT ENERGY SURGING THROUGH HIM. SHE CORRALS HIM TO THE BED. WRAPS HIM IN HER ARMS. BENJAMIN SEEMS TO SNAP OUT OF IT. He's disoriented - his eyes crazed, savage. Tori grips hi face with her hands - desperately trying to soothe him -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin - you're okay - you're okay... Benjamin is confused about where he is. He catches his breath. He studies his mother.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm with you now. She cradles him. Benjamin looks directly at Tori. Then -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Who am I? Tori stammers, searching for the right words -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You're... you're our son, you —

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Where did I come from? Tori knew this moment would come. She knows she has to le with him.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin... I know things have been difficult for you. I know you feel different from other kids. And you are different. (slowly, candidly) You are not from our world. We did not adopt you from an agency. You came here, in some... pod. From where I don't know. Benjamin nods, processing, almost resigned.  Blue (11/30/17) 43.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are special. A gift. She grasps his hand in hers.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There will be people who don't believe who you are and what you can do. That's why you have to show them that you are virtuous. And kind. And good. Benjamin can see his purpose.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mom. Everything makes sense now.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You have been sent here to do great things. But you will always be my baby boy. Benjamin smiles and puts his head on her shoulder. She st his hair. He's at ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caitlyn is propped up in bed, recuperating, her right han a bulging cast, her bones pinned with an external frame. A bowl of soup sits on a tray in front of her. She tries eat it with her left hand. Her hand shaking. Struggling t lift the spoon to her mouth. She sets the spoon down and sees - in the doorway - BENJA holding flowers. SHE JOLTS. Instantly petrified. Benjamin enters the bedroom. Caitlyn leaps from bed. She backs away from him.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLYN
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I got you flowers. She drifts toward the corner of her room, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLYN
dialogues.text: You can't.  Blue (11/30/17) 44. She's on edge. His demeanor is steady, placid.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Don't be scared. I want to talk to you. Benjamin slowly walks closer to her. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) Do you know what karma is? It's when you do something bad, and then something bad happens to you. It's another name for justice. Benjamin is almost upon her. Caitlyn is in agony.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's why, from now on, you should be careful what you say about me. Or karma might happen to you. Benjamin's face is next to hers. She can feel his breath. tear rolls down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you understand? She closes her eyes, wincing, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: CAITLYN
dialogues.text: (whispers) Yes. She opens her eyes. BENJAMIN IS GONE. Caitlyn is shaken. Exposed. She starts to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late afternoon. A low sun. Royce and his buddy Fauxhawk r their BMX's along a leaf-strewn train track that runs alo the bottom of a ravine. They talk about girls in their cl

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: No dude, Olivia's trash.

dialogues.speaker: FAUXHAWK
dialogues.text: Then who would you pick?  Blue (11/30/17) 45.

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: I guess Caitlyn. When she had two hands. They both burst out laughing as they approach the arched entrance to an old dark TRAIN TUNNEL, graffiti blanketing sides. All around them, an uproar of SQUAWKING CROWS. The boys notice, sitting above the tunnel, a SLIGHT FIGUR

dialogues.speaker: FAUXHAWK
dialogues.text: Jump, bitch! They both laugh. The figure just watches them.

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: Yo, nice mask. They laugh some more as they ride under the archway, the figure silently looking down at them. The guys ride their bikes into -

dialogues.speaker: THE DARK TRAIN TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Lit only by fading light from each end. The deeper they r the darker it gets. Royce makes mock ghost noises -

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: Qooo00000! They ride into the tunnel until it's pitch black. We can' a thing. We HEAR a STRANGE WHISKING NOISE, then the sound of the b being pitched and thrown to the ground, their metal bikes crashing, wheels spinning. Royce wails in agony.

dialogues.speaker: FAUXHAWK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (scared) What was that? What was that? Royce whimpers and mumbles incoherently. Fauxhawk turns on the flashlight on his phone and shines light on Royce. HIS NOSE BLEEDS, HIS MOUTH GUSHES THICK B ROYCE PULLS BROKEN TEETH FROM HIS GUMS. He's in a daze.  46.

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: Something hit me.

dialogues.speaker: FAUXHAWK
dialogues.text: (panicking) No... no... He moves the pin light over Royce's shoulder and sees - standing near their bikes - THE FIGURE IN THE MASK AND CA FAUXHAWK (CONT’D) Oh God, oh God... THE FIGURE WALKS TOWARD THEM. FAUXHAWK (CONT’D) (squealing) Royce! We gotta go! Fauxhawk helps a dazed Royce to his feet. They scramble as fast as they can toward the light at the of the tunnel. FAUXHAWK (CONT’D) Don't look back! Don't look back! Royce starts to whimper and cry. The two boys run. They make it to the end of the tunnel - BOTH BOYS ARE KNOCKED DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: THEY'RE DRAGGED BACK INTO THE DARKNESS, SCREAMING AND KIC
dialogues.text: They try to crawl away, but something flips them over. A foot pressed down on Royce's chest. He can barely breat The MASKED FIGURE looks down on the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Don't cross me. Royce recognizes the voice as Benjamin's. He gasps helple

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: Breyer? (struggling to breathe) Don't hurt me. Please. The pressure is released from his chest. Royce sits up.  47. They look down the tunnel to see the silhouette of Benjam walking away, his cape fluttering behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small-town Dairy Queen-like joint that has BBQ sandwich soft-serve ice cream, etc. Out in the middle of nowhere. locks up from inside, turns a door sign to CLOSED. The place is lit by bright fluorescents, the windows fogg in the chill night air. Erica - all in one shot - makes her way to a cash registe behind the front counter. She opens it up with a DING. Pu out the cash drawer. Closes it. Sets the drawer on the counter. She looks up and sees - written in the precipitation on a the windows -

dialogues.speaker: DIE DIE DIE DIE DIE DIE
dialogues.text: She's disturbed. The overhead fluorescent lights FLICKER. Erica growing more concerned.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Okay, who's fucking with me? The fluorescent bulbs SPASM ERRATICALLY, buzzing faintly, throwing Erica in and out of darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That you, Rick? No reply. Erica climbs on top of the front counter. She reaches up to one of the flickering lights. She strai touch it. She taps at the long tube. The light goes on for a moment Then goes out. She taps the light again - the fluorescent bulb FLARES WH HOT, then —

dialogues.speaker: SHE MOANS IN SEVERE PAIN.
dialogues.text: Through bursts of flickering light - She tries to prop herself up. Her face is CUT UP, BLEEDIN Jagged shards of glass fall from her cheek. She whimpers. Mewling. Her right eye stinging. A searing agony.

dialogues.speaker: EYE.
dialogues.text: She reaches up to it, letting out tiny cries, her hand shaking. She manages to pinch the shard of glass with her fingerti She holds her breath - AND STARTS TO PULL OUT THE GLASS SHARD FROM HER EYE.

dialogues.speaker: SHE PULLS IT OUT, CASTS IT ASIDE.
dialogues.text: Erica tries to see through the blood, her vision blurred jagged. Lights flickering amid the darkness - a strobe ef She looks up and sees, standing over her, in a nightmare of flicking light - BENJAMIN IN HIS RED MASK AND CAPE. The light flickers again and he's gone. She can hear him all sides of her. Everything blurry and confusing. Erica howls out in rage -—

dialogues.speaker: ERICA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Erica scrambles behind the counter. Half-blind, she frantically feels underneath the counter finds what she's looking for: A BASEBALL BAT. She tries to stand - SWINGING THE BAT WILDLY - GRUNTING L AN ANIMAL —

dialogues.speaker: NEAR. FAR. ON HER LEFT. HER RIGHT.
dialogues.text: Erica knocks over displays and condiment dispensers, swin the bat at Benjamin -

dialogues.speaker: ERICA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leave me the fuck alone! She can't fend him off. He seems to be all around her. Sh losing her mind.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nooo! She swings hard at Benjamin - misses - and HITS A BIG MET SODA STATION. THE BAT GETS JACKED OUT OF HER HAND and goe spiraling across the floor. She can't find it through the bursts of light. BENJAMIN APPEARS IN FRONT OF HER. Erica howls, turns, and runs toward the back area of the joint, knocking over tables. She staggers down a short back hallway, and comes to a wa freezer. She lifts the long master lock hanging loose on the latch then enters -

dialogues.speaker: A WALK-IN FREEZER
dialogues.text: She slams the door shut behind her and locks the handle t The air is frigid. But Erica is safe. She can see her terrified breath in the flickers of light Her breathing slows. She listens for noise on the other side of the door. She hears nothing. And then an eerie HISSING NOISE. Something CRACKLING. A pinpoint dot near the door handle starts to RIPPLE AND SCALDING FROM INTENSE RADIATION.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: No. No. No.  Blue (11/30/17) 50. She backs away from the door. Freaked out. The INTENSE HE CARVING A HOLE AROUND THE DOOR HANDLE. Erica retreats further into the walk-in freezer, amid she of frozen food. Lights spasming. Nowhere to hide. She looks all around her, braced, ready - In the flicker of light we can see - ABOVE HER — BENJAMIN HIS MASK. Erica turns - looks up - too late - BENJAMIN SWOOPS DOWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle plops a serving of mac 'n' cheese onto his plate. He uneasy, doesn't want to be here. Tori sits to one side of him at the dining room table. Benjamin on the other, hands folded, staring calmly. Everyone has food on their plates.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (mutters ) Let's say grace. He reaches out to either side of him - Tori takes Kyle's but Benjamin keeps his hands folded.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Can I say something first? Kyle looks at Tori - this is unusual.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I'd like to tell you something I'm grateful for. Tori smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you for adopting me. For the first time I finally feel like I belong. I feel good. Benjamin takes his parents' hands, the three of them now joined.  Blue (11/30/17) 51. Kyle brightens. He closes his eyes -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Thank you Lord for this bounty before us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A misty morning. Deever and the young female deputy - her is REYES - saunter throughout the place. The emergency li from their squad car swirls lazily in the parking lot. Deever and Reyes pick their way through the wreckage - sm up cups and condiments everywhere. Broken light bulbs.

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: You say she hasn't responded to any calls or texts?

dialogues.speaker: REYES
dialogues.text: That's correct. This is the last place she was seen. Her daughter hasn't heard from her.

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: Damn. That poor girl needs her mom real bad right now. Deever comes to BROKEN GLASS AND DROPS OF BLOOD near the counter, the spot where Erica removed the shard from her Deever crouches down to scrutinize it.

dialogues.speaker: REYES
dialogues.text: Sir? Reyes gestures up toward the ceiling. Deever looks up and sees, scraped into the plaster overhe STYLIZED 'B', like the ones Benjamin had been doodling in notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royce is at his locker gathering books - his lip split, h mouth bruised. He closes his locker to reveal Benjamin walking down the toward him. Royce is guarded, deferential. Benjamin is ca dead-eyed.  Blue (11/30/17) 52. Royce watches Benjamin pass him by. Fauxhawk sees Benjami veers out of the way. All the kids in the school watch Benjamin, hushed, terrified. The word is out. A pall has descended on the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smallish office space - inspirational posters, painted cinderblock walls. Benjamin's aunt Merilee sits in a chai notepad on her lap. Benjamin sits across from her on a small couch.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: So Benjamin - this is your first day back since the incident... As she talks he takes in knick-knacks and photos on her d a frame photo of Noah; Merilee with her arm around Tori; Merilee with Noah in some tropical location holding cockt She's in a bikini top and a sarong.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanted to talk to you about how you're adjusting. How you're feeling, how your classes are going. Benjamin stares at the photo of Merilee on vacation, tann and nubile.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Benjamin? Benjamin turns to Merilee. He looks at her an uncomfortab long time. Then -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: That you have to be here, counseling me.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Benjamin... I enjoy being with you.  Benjamin forward. Benjamin Benjamin 53.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You have to say that.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: No - I really do! looks down. Merilee sets her notepad aside. She leans

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look - Benjamin - I know you haven't had the easiest time making friends. But I think you're worth getting to know. scrunches his face.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember that time we went to Worlds of Fun, and everyone else was too chicken to ride the Mamba, so you and I went on it over and over? enjoys the memory.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were a blast! She leans in closer to him - conspiratorial -

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you know what I say to the people who don't want to be around you? She squeezes his hand and whispers - Benjamin

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eff ‘em. smiles. Merilee reaches for her notebook.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, back to business. How are your classes going?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Good.  54.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: If you find yourself falling behind in any of your schoolwork, please know my door is always open... As she speaks, Benjamin stares at her. STUDYING HER. TRAC HER WITH HIS EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun rock music plays. Kyle and Noah play pool with a coup friends, blue-collar dudes. They're mid-conversation -

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, my buddy told me the whole joint was just wrecked, and Erica was gone. It's been over twenty- four hours. MALIK - a forty-something buddy - jokes -

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: Kyle - you think your son coulda done it? Noah swats Malik's arm. MALIK (CONT’D) What? He did crush her daughter's hand.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Not funny right now.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: What's gonna happen with all that?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: He was suspended for a couple days. And I'm sure I'll hear from some lawyer soon, painting my son as a monster. Which - I don't even know anymore - maybe he is. The guys laugh good-naturedly.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Dude, all kids are monsters. One night, long time ago, we had a new babysitter over. And my daughter - four years old at the time - asks her if she has a boyfriend. Babysitter says no. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And my daughter goes 'is it because you're so ugly?' The other guys laugh - ooh, that's bad.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But that's what it means to be a parent. You love 'em despite their awfulness. A waitress sets down a pitcher of beer. Noah, a little bu takes it from her and puts his arm around his brother-in-

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: This guy needs another beer! But Kyle isn't placated. He's lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple Midwestern home. Spotify plays oldies music. Merilee, wearing only an oversized t-shirt that goes down her mid-thigh, has a laundry basket tucked under her arm. FOLLOW HER IN A HAND-HELD ONER as -— She enters a bathroom, gathers some bath towels and throw them in the laundry basket. She walks with the basket down a hallway. The music reced bit. She enters her dark bedroom - Past a window. Outside we see THE FAINT OUTLINE OF A FACE A PAIR OF GLOWING EYES - LUMINESCENT RED - WATCHING HER. Merilee walks right past the window, turns on a lamp on t night table. Now all we can see is her reflection in the glass. She gathers more clothes from the laundry hamper. Then re under her t-shirt, removes her bra, and throws it in the laundry. She turns off the lamp and passes the window. The figure outside is gone. Merilee exits the room and heads downstairs. The music plays. Merilee stops by a side table, picks up glass of red wine, and drinks. Then, above her -  56. A SLIGHT CREAK. Merilee stops drinking. She hears more CREAKS. Across the length of the roof abov living room. Are those... footsteps? Merilee is suddenly alert. Uneasy. She sets down the wineglass. She goes to the front door - opens - and steps outside -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is off a lonely rural road. Crickets rattling. Merilee slowly backs her way down her front driveway to g better angle on the roof. She stands on her tiptoes, trying to see if anyone is up there. She backs up further -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aunt Merilee? Merilee JUMPS. Benjamin is behind her, in the middle of t driveway, wearing his backpack. Merilee laughs at herself

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Benjamin! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I was thinking about you. Merilee is confused.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You said if I fell behind in any of my schoolwork that your door is always open. I've been falling behind in social studies.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: How'd you get here?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I walked.  Blue (11/30/17) 57.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Five miles?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You know what, maybe I should head back.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: No, I'll call your mom, have her pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: She's working late tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Okay, well. Noah's out and I'm in no shape to drive, so... Why don't you just come on in? Merilee heads back toward her front door. Benjamin follow her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori is in her work polo. She sets down takeout bags on t kitchen table. She calls out -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin! I have sesame chicken! She goes through the living room turning on lights. The grandfather clock TICK-TOCKS. Tori walks a few steps up the stairs -—

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin stands in an open kitchen - out of Merilee's eyesight - pouring himself a glass of water. A mellow ste guitar country song plays in the other room.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ice cubes are in the bottom freezer! Benjamin fills up her glass with red wine. He then takes Ziploc bag that contains FOUR PINK PILLS - Kyle's OxyCont  58. He squeezes the bag, powdering the pills between his fing then DUMPS THEM INTO THE GLASS OF WINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malik sinks the 8 ball. He and Travis slap five.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: One more?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: (tipsy) Naw man - I don't get home soon Merilee's gonna kill me. Kyle intercepts Noah as he puts on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Sure you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: (shrugging him off) It's just a few miles down the road. Kyle nods. Noah zips up his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin carries both the glass of water and wine into th other room. Merilee sits on a cushy sofa.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: What? He sets the glass of wine before her.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: I didn't ask for another glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Oh. I feel stupid now.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Don't. It's fine. She takes a drink. Benjamin sits across from her.  59.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: So can I ask you something? Merilee gives him a look: sure. She takes

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How come you don't have any children?

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Benjamin!

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Is that inappropriate?

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Of course it is.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. another drink. Her mind starts to drift.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: I'm ready for kids. Noah, not so much. I stopped taking the pill a few months ago, just to see. (catching herself) Oh my God, listen to me. You're twelve! Merilee really feeling woozy now. Benjamin stares at her. grows introspective. A little sad.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Noah says things are going so good now - why risk messing that up with a child?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: If I ever had a child, I'd see it as a gift. A miracle. She laughs. Fading. Half-conscious...

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Get back to me in ten years, see if you still feel that way. Merilee leans her head back. She looks up at the ceiling. The music becomes MUFFLED, DREAMY, DROPS OUT... She mutters something unintelligible then drifts off.  60. Benjamin sits across from her, staring at her as she lies there passed out. Several moments pass. He reaches down to his backpack, unzips it. He pulls out red mask with the mouth and eye holes. He puts it over his head. He stares at Merilee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah walks from his truck - a flatbed with a fiberglass t cap - toward his front door. He inserts his key, opens the door, and enters -

dialogues.speaker: HIS LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: A dim lamp on. A doleful song playing eerily. Noah goes i the kitchen, opens the fridge. He grabs a beer, pops it open. He takes a swig as he sift through mail on the counter. He notices an empty wine bottle on its side on the counte He hears, from upstairs, a door CREAK SHUT. He calls out -

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Mare? No answer. Noah turns off the music. The place now DEAD QUIET. Noah makes his way upstairs. He heads down the hallway. The bedroom door is shut. He turns the door knob. The door squeaks open.  61.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: The room almost pitch dark. Noah can make out Merilee SPRAWLED atop the floral comfor arms and legs akimbo, her long t-shirt hiked over her thi passed out. Noah crouches next to Merilee. He caresses Merilee's hair. He's unsettled, queasy.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Honey Bear? She's not responsive. He turns on a bedside lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes closed, Merilee mumbles distantly. He's concerned. He stands, turns, and SEES BENJAMIN BEHIND HIM. He FLINCH

dialogues.speaker: NOAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus! (shaken, pissed) What the fuck? Noah rips off the mask. Benjamin calmly looks back at him

dialogues.speaker: NOAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I helped put her to bed.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: No - here. In my house. With that stupid goddamn mask.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: She was helping me with my homework. Noah, furious, grabs Benjamin by the collar -

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Let's go. Noah drags him out of the room. Down the stairs. Into -  62.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Noah marches toward the front door, churning.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I'm very disappointed, Benjamin. Very disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything. Noah fumes. It takes everything in him not to pound the s out of Benjamin. He makes his way out into -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Are you going to tell my parents?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You're lucky if that's all I do. Noah opens up the passenger door for Benjamin to get in. door ajar CHIMES. Noah strides toward the driver's side - He notices a light over the garage door FLICKER and BUZZ, shrugs it off, starts to climb behind the wheel. He sees Benjamin is still outside. He storms back over toward the passenger side -

dialogues.speaker: NOAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Benjamin! Benjamin stands next to the truck, holding the mask in hi hands.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You shouldn't say anything to my parents. Noah - pissed - grabs Benjamin by the arm -

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Get in the truck! He throws his weight into Benjamin. Benjamin makes a move

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah falls in a heap. He gathers himself to his knees. Wheezing. Coughing up blood onto the asphalt. He looks back at Benjamin, who stands there, unmoved. The car door continues to chime.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
