dialogues.text: I didn't want to hurt you, but you made me. Noah sees the coldness in Benjamin's eyes. He crawls towa his truck - pure survival mode. He climbs into the front seat - grimacing. He throws the vehicle into drive and SQUEALS OUT OF HIS DRIVEWAY. The truck TEARS DOWN THE LONG EMPTY ROAD.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Noah - rasping, terrified - looks in his side mirror. He a GLIMPSE of something, a BLUR. Noah SCREAMING INSIDE. Pure panic. He looks out the side mirror again - nothing there. Then he feels a JOLT - as if something is leaping onto th truck cap. He hears footsteps on the roof - what the hell? Noah trie keep his eye on the road -— The truck HEADLIGHTS BROWN OUT. The DASHBOARD LIGHTS FADE The engine DIES. Noah's truck COMES TO A STOP. Noah tries to start the truck. It clicks over and over. Battery shot. Noah desperately pounds the steering wheel. Noah sits in the middle of country road. Lights out. SURROUNDED BY PITCH BLACKNESS. He's terrified. Hyper-alert. He locks the driver's door. reaches over and locks the passenger door. He sits there, trapped. His breathing shallow. His headlights flicker -  64. Noah can see, up ahead - Benjamin in his mask HOVERING A INCHES ABOVE THE ROAD.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: No. No no no. Noah quivers with fear. Through the flickering headlights sees Benjamin -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS MASKED FACE ALMOST ON HIM -— NOAH SCREAMS AS -—

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK TUMBLING OVER...
dialogues.text: It comes to a stop. Noah looks down and sees his own blood pooling on the roa He's wedged into the wreckage, the truck resting on its s in the middle of the road. Noah is dazed. His pupils dilated. Blood runs from his ja hanging loosely, dislocated. He tries to move it into pla but it won't stay. His mouth filled with blood. He looks up and sees - through the shattered windshield - BENJAMIN STANDING THERE. Noah rattles out slow, labored breaths. He sees Benjamin STARTING TO WALK DIRECTLY TOWARD HIM. SL METHODICALLY. Noah reaches into his pocket. Takes out his cell phone. Fingers bloody - shaking - he precariously dials - 9-1- Then DROPS THE PHONE. It clatters onto the hard asphalt. Noah - wedged in, helpless - watches Benjamin approach hi if in a dream. Benjamin squats near him. Leans in close. The slow surf o Noah's breath drawing in.  65. Noah gurgles, a faint murmur -

dialogues.speaker: NOAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What... are you? Benjamin says nothing. Just stares at Noah, scrutinizing Noah chokes out a plea - barely audible -

dialogues.speaker: NOAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help me. Benjamin watches, impassive. He reaches out with his fing and INSERTS IT INTO THE OPEN GASH IN NOAH'S NECK. Noah tries to say something but can't. He stops breathing. His eyes glass over. He's dead. Benjamin studies the pearly crimson splotch on his finger almost fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori and Kyle, keyed up, pace their kitchen. She's on her phone -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (into cell) Sorry I keep leaving messages, Merilee, but it's after ten, we still haven't heard from Benjamin. Have you seen him at all?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (to Tori) Did he say anything to her at school?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (into cell) Did he mention somewhere he had to be? I know I'm rambling, but I'm kinda freaking. So call me. Please. She ends the call, looks at Kyle, and sighs, weary. Kyle her a suggestive look.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?  66.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (too innocent) I didn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Okay, you told me so. I get it. Kyle sighs, frustrated. Then - the front door CREAKS open Tori and Kyle rush into the living room - Benjamin ENTERS THE HOUSE. HE'S SHIRTLESS. Holding his wadded-up t-shirt in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Benjamin! My God. Where were you? Kyle hugs him. Benjamin doesn't hug back.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened to your shirt?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I ripped it. Playing soccer.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Is that where you been all this time?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Royce and those guys asked if I wanted to play after school.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (not buying it) Royce asked you to play soccer?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Well, kinda. They started playing rough - elbowing me, tripping me to the ground. That's how I tore my shirt. So I decided to walk home. I should've called, I know. Tori places her hand on Benjamin's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, baby. You okay? He nods. Kyle is leery.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you had anything to eat?  Blue (11/30/17) 67.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry. I just want to go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Okay. Here, I'll wash that - She reaches for his shirt and he pulls it away from her.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Thanks. As Benjamin heads upstairs -—

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: ‘Night. Kyle is alone with Tori.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You believe that story?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't I? Royce and those boys have been bullying him since second grade.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Which he knows you know, which is why he came up with that bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Okay then, what else do you think he was out there doing?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I don't know what he was doing, I don't know who he is. That's the whole goddamn point. Kyle sinks into a chair, puts his head in his hands. He f like he's drowning, and Tori can't help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middle of the night. Tori asleep. Kyle lying next to her. can't sleep. He pops an OxyContin tablet and leans his head back, swallowing it. He hears a SLIGHT CREAK from the hallway floorboards.  68. Then the sound of MUFFLED ALIEN GIBBERISH.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Tori? You hear that? She rests peacefully. He gets out of bed. He saunters toward the bedroom door. Opens it. The hallway is dark. Empty. Kyle has trouble getting his bearings. He looks up. He sees BENJAMIN BENT OVER, CONTORTED, CRAWLING ON THE CEILING, HIS EYES ROLLED BACK IN HIS HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Benjamin? BENJAMIN STARTS TO CRY. HE'S IN PAIN. Kyle reaches up to him -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here. It's okay. Benjamin reaches down to his dad - AND GRIPS HIS FACE WITH HIS FINGERTIPS —

dialogues.speaker: KYLE'S BONES SNAPPING
dialogues.text: BENJAMIN'S FINGERS —

dialogues.speaker: KYLE JOLTS UP_IN BED. SUDDENLY AWAKE FROM HIS DREAM STUPO
dialogues.text: Kyle gathers himself, rattled. Tori sleeps peacefully nex him. Kyle peers under the space beneath the closed bedroom doo Was he just dreaming? Tori's RINGTONE LOUDLY SPLITS THE NIGHT. She reaches for her phone, mumbles a sleepy hello. She grows troubled. Like the wind's been knocked out of h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERILEE SOBS INTO TORI'S SHOULDER as they hold each other tight. Kyle puts a consoling hand on Tori and Merilee's backs. They're in a dim hallway. Linoleum floor. Gloomy lighting Tori - her face red from tears - whispers tenderly -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: It's okay. Let it out. Merilee breaks the embrace, tries to gather herself.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: They won't even let me see him. They said he's all - She flutters her hands, indicating Noah is a mess.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Do they know how it happened?

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: He was on Route 18. They think he hit a deer or a cow or something. They're gonna do a toxicology whatever to see if he was, you know, impaired. Tori looks to Kyle, almost accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: He had, like, two beers. Maybe three, I wasn't counting.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Why didn't you drive him home?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No one's even on those roads at night. Tori glares at him. Merilee sniffles.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: How's Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: We haven't told him yet. Just said we had something urgent.  Blue (11/30/17) 70.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: So he got home okay? Tori nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it's a blur. I don't remember when he left exactly. Tori is confused.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Left where?

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: He came over. He wanted help with his homework. A FEELING OF DREAD wells up in Tori and Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milky first light of morning. Benjamin sits with Kyle and Tori. The two of them have been up all night. They're sol measured.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: This may be difficult for you to hear, but we wanted you to know that... your Uncle Noah - he, uh - She's emotional, has trouble finding the words.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: He died last night.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: A car accident. Benjamin takes a deep breath. As if absorbing the news. K studies his reactions.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: It's weird. I feel like maybe I should cry or something. Benjamin just sits there.  Blue (11/30/17) 71.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Now, Benjamin, we know you were at Aunt Merilee's last night. Benjamin takes this in, unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm your mother, and I will always defend you. But if you know anything about what happened to Noah, it's okay to tell us. Benjamin regards his parents for a moment. Then -—

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: All right. I'm gonna be totally honest with you. He looks Tori and Kyle in the eye. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) I was at Aunt Merilee's last night. She was helping me with my homework. Then she said she was tired, so I left, and I saw Noah in the driveway. He was yelling and acting strange, like he was drunk. Then he drove off. That's the last I saw him.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: So all that playing-soccer stuff was a lie.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Yes. I made up something that I thought would make me sound less - I don't know. Less weird. Tori is relieved. Kyle is not. He leans in.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I gotta ask, Benjamin - what other things have you been lying about?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (cautioning) Kyle.  72.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Were you outside Caitlyn's bedroom before you broke her hand?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: He was camping with us, Kyle! Kyle just stares at Benjamin -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Where were you on Wednesday night? The night Caitlyn's mom went missing?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: This is not helping -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (to Benjamin) What happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Stop it -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: He's lying to our fucking faces!

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I'm going to go upstairs. Benjamin rises to go.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No - we're getting it all on the table! Right now!

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Kyle!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (to Benjamin) Did you hurt Noah? Did you hurt him? Kyle is starting to unravel. Benjamin stares at him. Kyle pins Benjamin against the wall. The lights in the ro start to FLICKER.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Stop this - please!  73.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (to Benjamin) What did you do? He was my friend! And you just fucking - Benjamin's voice comes out harsh - evil -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Leave me alone! Light bulbs POP AND SHATTER - Benjamin HURLS KYLE INTO A CABINET, plates shattering.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin! She rushes to Kyle, on the ground, aching. Benjamin stand over them.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just go. Get ready for school. Benjamin turns and calmly walks upstairs. Kyle is alone with Tori. Stewing, she gathers pieces of t broken plates.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn it, Kyle. Kyle, churning inside, hears the shower upstairs SQUEAK o He gets up. Brushes past Tori. Ambles up the stairs on his one good leg -

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Kyle sees the bathroom door closed, hears the shower runn He heads toward Benjamin's bedroom at the end of the hall He goes into -—

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Kyle's heart rate SPIKING. He opens dresser drawers. Sifts through sweatshirts, jean shorts, looking for something. TENSION MUSIC RISING.  74. He glances again at the doorway. The shower still running He goes through items scattered on the floor. He runs his arm between Benjamin's mattress and box sprin but comes up empty. The bathroom shower WHINES OFF. The water stops running. ALL IS SILENT. Kyle freezes. He knows he should leave the room, but he c He hurriedly PRESSES ON - He opens Benjamin's walk-in closet. Rummages through dirt clothes, old toys, old trinkets. He's frantic now. Benjamin could walk in any moment! He finds a gap at the base of the closet where the drywal detached from the studs. He reaches into the dark cavity and finds something. He pulls out - THE WADDED-UP T-SHIRT Benjamin was holding the night befo He's terrified. Mind racing. He unfurls the shirt. It's tattered. SMEARED WITH BLOOD. Kyle is paralyzed with horror. He leaves the closet -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Dad? Kyle STARTLES, hides the shirt behind his back. Benjamin stands there, towel around his waist.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Kyle is terrified of his son.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Just... uh... I wanted to apologize.  Blue (11/30/17) 15. Benjamin studies him.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've both had a lot going on lately. And I shouldn't have said the things I said. Benjamin nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Thank you. For understanding. Kyle tries to play casual, but he's nervous as hell. He m past Benjamin out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle has the blood- and paint-streaked shirt splayed out before Tori. The two of them talk low, hushed, but Kyle i disturbed, animated -—

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It's right there. Tori is at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's the shirt he was hiding from us last night! That's Noah's blood!

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (derisively) What are you saying - that Noah's truck hit Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know what I think.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: The truck is totaled. Benjamin wouldn't have a bone left in his body! Kyle pleads with her -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Babe... if we don't do something, more people will get hurt. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: More people will die. You've got to be with me on this -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You're asking me to turn against our son?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (pointedly) He is not our son. He's some thing we found in the woods. Tori is full of spite for Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You don't understand him. You never did.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: For twelve fucking years I've understood him! (pointing to the bloody shirt) This is Benjamin! Right here! A monster! Tori starts to cry -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You're wrong. He's good. We can't run from him. We need to be his parents. We need to love him.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (desperate) You know I tried and tried to love him.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You never did. You never wanted him. Kyle is now on the verge of tears -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Please please - he's killing us - He reaches out to Tori, but she shuns him. She turns and walks out of the room. Kyle is desperate. Fraying. He collapses into his desk chair.  Blue (11/30/17) 77. He opens the bottom desk drawer. Reaches behind some hanging files, deep in back. He pulls the bundled sock, removes the bottle of OxyContin, then s short. He notices, in the same desk drawer - A PILE OF ART PROJECTS made by Benjamin over the years. H sets down the OxyContin and lingers over them: A Father's Day card with crayon hearts and a school photo Benjamin, age 8. A ceramic dish with Benjamin's handprint, age 5. A popsicle-stick picture frame with a photo of the whole family and MOM, DAD, and BENJAMIN written in Magic Marker the sides. He's wracked with emotion. He fights back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori lies on her side, curled up in bed. She's lost ina stupor. Kyle climbs in bed next to her. He spoons her. She doesn' move.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You okay? Tori shrugs. Gives him nothing.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I've been thinking... I was wrong. She takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have accused Ben of any of that stuff. I know he has problems, yes, but I'm starting to think maybe I'm the biggest one. Tori nods. She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to take him with me to the woods. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let him use that rifle, teach him how to hunt, like my dad did with me. I want to work things out with him. Let him know I love him. Tori turns her body toward Kyle. She takes his hand in he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deever sits at his desk with a cup of coffee, binders and files open on his desk. He studies the crash report for Noah. He sifts past EDR data, tire mark analyses, GRISLY CRASH PHOTOS, NOAH'S TRAUMATIC WOUNDS, HIS DEAD BODY. He finds a long shot of the crushed car. He sees a small blurry detail in the photo. We can't make it out, but he's taken aback. Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle wears an insulated jacket, packs up his truck. He lo pair of hunting rifles next to duffel bags and camping ge Benjamin hands him the tent -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. He smiles, slides the tent into the back, slams the hatch Tori meets up with the guys. She zips up Benjamin's jacke

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: And here - take these. She hands him a pair of winter gloves.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: It's not that cold.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Out there in the woods it is. Benjamin sighs.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wear them for me.  79.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Okay... He takes them.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, Mom... I'm sorry I lied and stuff. Tori regards Benjamin, full of affection for him -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Come here. She hugs him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay. We all make mistakes. But you'll always be my baby boy. Benjamin hugs her back. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It's a good hour and a half each way, so don't expect us before supper. Tori smiles warmly at Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Be safe. He smiles back at her. A moment between them. Tori watches the guys climb into the truck. The doors shut. The vehicle revs up. Kyle, looking in the rearview mirror, wiggles his fingers goodbye. The truck crunches gravel down the driveway, leaving Tori the house further and further behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deever strides onto the stretch of highway where Noah die his squad car parked on the shoulder. There are still bits of debris in the road. Nearby, a sad roadside memorial - unlit votive candles, handwritten not flowers in cellophane. Deever comes to the middle of the road.  80. He looks down. There, scrawled on the asphalt, is the SAME DISTINCTIVE ' INSIGNIA he saw back at the fast food place. THIS TIME IN BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: An endless road. The car stereo plays some old tune. Kyle glances over at Benjamin, gazing out the window. Gra Kansas sky. Bare trees. Flat land for miles. The song now interrupted by STATIC, the station losing it signal. Kyle tries to adjust the dial. No good. He changes statio farm report. A country song. All of them ENGULFED BY WHIT NOISE. He shuts off the radio. They drive in silence. Just the SQUEAK of shock absorbers going over bumps in the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Benjamin sit on a log by the parked pickup, eati sandwiches, their rifles in nylon sleeves nearby. Sunlight glitters through incandescent yellow and orange cottonwoods. TENSION MUSIC creeps in as the two guys - father and son side by side, eating, not looking or talking to each othe Kyle offers Benjamin a snack-size can of Pringles. He shakes his head no thanks. Kyle eats a Pringle instead. The two guys eat their lunches, staring off in the distan A feeling of dread hovering over them.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori stands at the sink drying a salad bowl when she noti outside - a POLICE CAR driving up the long driveway towar house. She's concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori emerges from the house, stands on her porch. Deever steps out of his car and approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: Afternoon, Tori.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: Well... could be. Not exactly sure yet. Is your son around by chance?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: He's out hunting with his dad.

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: Then maybe you could answer a question for me. He shows a Polaroid to Tori.

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This look familiar to you? It's the 'B' INSIGNIA IN BLOOD on the road. Tori grows concerned, but hides it -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: No. Should it?

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: It's some kind of signature, left at the spots where both Erica went missing and Noah died. Tori tries to keep her composure.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I don't... I can't help you with that.  82.

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: Doesn't it look to you like a B maybe? As in Benjamin Breyer?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I don't like where this is going. Deever motions inside -

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: Mind if I come in, take a look around?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have to ask you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: If you think you're helping your son, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Get off my property. Deever grits his teeth, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: All right. But you know I'll be back. Tori stands there defiantly as Deever heads toward his sq car and climbs in the front seat. He fires up the engine. Tori shuts and locks the front door, turns, and — SPRINTS UP THE STAIRS, ADRENALINE PUMPING, HORRIFIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Benjamin LURCH THROUGH THE WOODS holding their rifles. A low tangerine sun. Dead leaves CRACKLING under shoes. The guys venture deeper into the woods. Kyle's eyes darti exploring options, a coiled spring. As they get deeper into the forest, a CROW starts to squa  83. First one. Then another. Kyle looks up and sees more and more of them - dark splot in the trees -

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Something must've spooked those crows. Benjamin notices something. He scurries ahead. He crouches down before a slather of mud -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: It was a deer. These are tracks. He examines the tracks, his back to Kyle. Kyle's heart rate quickens. This is the moment.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This way. BENJAMIN LOOKS BACK - Kyle quickly LOWERS HIS WEAPON. He nods. Sure. Let's go. Benjamin stalks ahead. Kyle follows behind. Benjamin searches around him, every branch carrying information. The crows SCREECH MADLY. Kyle - queasy now, dying inside - follows Benjamin. Benjamin stops to examine a small tuft of fur on a brambl Kyle stops about ten feet behind him. THE SCREECHING CROWS build to a RISING CHORUS, THEIR SCRE RAINING DOWN ON BENJAMIN AND KYLE. KYLE KNOWS THIS IS IT. HE LIFTS HIS RIFLE. POINTS THE BARREL AT THE BACK OF BENJAMIN'S HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TORI CHARGES INTO BENJAMIN'S ROOM, her world spinning. She tears through items on Benjamin's floor. Finds his backpack. Unzips it. Pulls out his notebook. She opens it - And takes in PAGE AFTER PAGE OF HORROR — CLINICAL DRAWINGS OF THE FEMALE REPRODUCTIVE SYSTEM.

dialogues.speaker: WOMEN IN CHAINS. DRAWINGS OF SEX AND TORTURE.
dialogues.text: Tori is BREATHLESS, BOTTOMING OUT, leafing through the notebook - Then she sees -

dialogues.speaker: HIS CHEST.
dialogues.text: Tori FALLS TO HER KNEES. She clutches herself, practically dry heaving - A WAIL OF AGONY building inside her, spilling over.

dialogues.speaker: CHOKING BACK EMOTION.
dialogues.text: HE SQUEEZES THE TRIGGER —  85.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIFLE FIRES -
dialogues.text: THE BULLET HITS BENJAMIN IN THE HEAD, BEHIND HIS EAR -—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crows go quiet. Benjamin - staggered but still on his feet - feels the ba his head. No wound. No blood. HE TURNS TOWARD KYLE. Kyle stands there. Frozen. Panic rising. He frantically ejects the shell from the rifle then digs his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You never wanted me. KYLE FUMBLES FOR A NEW BULLET, hands shaking. Benjamin GR BENJAMIN (CONT’D) You never made me feel at home. Kyle loads the bullet into the rifle, pushes the bolt for raises the rifle - - and FIRES - DIRECTLY AT BENJAMIN'S CHEST. The bullet rips open Benjamin's shirt and RICOCHETS off somewhere. Benjamin stares at Kyle with HOMICIDAL RAGE.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Oh God I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Kyle drops the rifle - turns - and RUNS AWAY AS FAST AS H LEG WILL ALLOW -— Through cottonwood trees. Willing himself forward. Faster Trying to put space between him and Benjamin. He's desperate. Prey. He feels a GUST - a kind of MOAN - blow past him. He chan direction, looks around, still running.  86. Trees whizzing by. He thinks he sees SOMETHING TO THE OTH SIDE OF HIM - a BLUR. He changes direction again. Huffing. Stumbling. Lungs bur Benjamin seems to be HERE - THERE - AHEAD OF HIM - BEHIND EVERYWHERE AND NOWHERE. Then BENJAMIN TACKLES KYLE TO THE GROUND. HARD. LIKE A SE HIT HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori - worked up - holds her cell phone to her ear. The l rings. To herself -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Pick up, pick up... The line ANSWERS.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (frantic) Kyle, I'm so sorry! You were right! Benjamin killed Noah! He killed him! No reply from the other hand. Just the soft hiss of stati

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kyle? The line still hissing - giving up nothing. Then -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (starting to whimper) Benjamin? Where's Dad?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He's gone. Tori's stomach turns. She's terrified.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Gone where?  87.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (accusingly) You know.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: I don't know - I swear - I don't! Tori falling apart -

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did you do to him? What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (cold, flat) I'm coming home, Mom. The other line CLICKS DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin?... Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin is on top of a weak and wearied Kyle. Benjamin d the phone. He clutches his father's head with both hands. RAGE BUILD Veins and capillaries around Benjamin's temples swell. Hi eyes GLOW RED - SMOLDERING WITH IMPOSSIBLE HEAT.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No - no!

dialogues.speaker: INTENSE BEAMS OF RADIATION ERUPT FROM BENJAMIN'S EYE SOCK
dialogues.text: KYLE SCREAMS -—

dialogues.speaker: HIS SKULL CAVES IN AND COLLAPSES.
dialogues.text: Kyle's body sags. He STOPS MOVING. His head a gummy mass of boiled skin and muscle. Benjamin lets his dad's corpse drop. The forest is quiet.  Blue (11/30/17) 88. Leaves shaking in the breeze. Some animal function has now taken over Benjamin. He roil with predatory fury. He lets out a PAINED, UNEARTHLY WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREEEEACH. SCREEEEACH. Tori drags a heavy CHINA HUTCH to the front door, digging up the old hardwood floor. Panting, she catches her breath. Then tries again - exert herself - PULLING THE HUTCH until it BLOCKS THE DOOR. Tori has barricaded herself in. A bookshelf is pushed aga the front window. Kitchen table jammed against the back d She's alone. Grandfather clock TICKING. She goes to the fireplace set, picks up an IRON POKER, ho at the tip. She carries it like a weapon. She gently peels back the heavy living room drapes. Peers outside - Half moon. Shadowy trees. An old tire swing swaying from oak tree. She closes the drapes. She's a live-wire of edginess, trying to stay calm, tryin focus. She holds the iron poker in front of her. Ready. She can hear her own breathing. Her own heartbeat. The world seems to stop. Then -

dialogues.speaker: THE WHOLE HOUSE SHUDDERS. AS IF RAMMED BY A WRECKING BALL
dialogues.text: Sawdust falling. Tori takes out her phone. Dials 9-1-1. The line picks up, woman's voice -

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?  Blue (11/30/17) 89.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (whispers) My son - he's - he's going to hurt me. Tori retreats from the front door, against a wall with fr photos of Benjamin at various ages.

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where is your son now? AN IMPACT FROM THE SIDE OF THE HOUSE. The foundation RATTLING. Frame CRACKING.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (rasping) He's twelve years old. This shouldn't be happening.

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Stay calm. Where is he now? Tori feeling like a cornered animal.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: We found him in the woods when he was a baby, in some —

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Oh God - this can't be happening. In some sort of pod. Tori hides under the dining room table, a sheer linen tablecloth her only refuge.

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ma'am, please - where - ?

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (voice cracking) He's trying to get in -

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At your front door, ma'am, or -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Through the walls. He... has... powers.

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ma'am —

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: (sobbing) I thought he was here for good. But I think he's here to kill all of us! THE FRONT OF THE HOUSE IS BLOWN IN — WALLS COLLAPSING —

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN CRASHING INTO THE SECOND FLOOR OF THE HOUSE.
dialogues.text: The dust starts to dissipate and clear. Tori stands, gets bearings. HALF THE LIVING ROOM IS GONE. EVERYTHING — WALLS, FLOOR, THE WHOLE SIDE OF THE HOUSE — OBLITERATED IN A CLOUD OF DUST AND DEBRIS. Pink heating insulation torn, dangling. Frayed electric w FLICKERING through the haze. Tori grips the poker. Senses ringing. FOOTSTEPS CREAK above her. Tori hears —

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (childlike voice) Mom?... Mom, are you here? She can HEAR Benjamin proceeding from room to room. She can make out the low rumble of a closet door rolling Tori slowly - gingerly - walks toward the open space in t living room. She can see - through the haze - Benjamin STARTING TO WAL

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Tori turns and hurries through the dining room, into -  91.

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: She motions toward the back door, then spots a glimpse of Benjamin's silhouette through the dust. She can't reach the back door without stepping into his s line. So she backs slowly toward the study, then scurries up -

dialogues.speaker: A REAR STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: She arrives upstairs. Almost pitch black. She peers down through the balusters in the stairs - look for signs of Benjamin. A game of cat and mouse. She listens. She can hear the cellar door CREAK open. FOOTSTEPS heading into the cellar. Tori feels safe enough to head downstairs. She's going to her escape. Then -

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: A BATTERING from below. Tori turns tail and RUNS DOWN -

dialogues.speaker: SHE'S WRAPPED IN A BEAR HUG
dialogues.text: IT'S DEEVER AND Reyes ARMED WITH SHOTGUNS.

dialogues.speaker: DEEVER
dialogues.text: You're safe now. We got you. Everything's gonna be o- Something WHISKS PAST HIM. Deever stops short.  92. He feels something and looks down - PART OF HIS THROAT HA BEEN TORN AWAY. BLOOD STARTS SPILLING DOWN HIS SHIRT. Tori's eyes widen in horror - almost hyperventilating. ANOTHER WHISK and Deever's head caves in. His face is deformed, his eyeball coming out a little bit. He falls o dead. As Tori SCREAMS, Reyes drags her away - pulling her into

dialogues.speaker: A SPARE ROOM
dialogues.text: An old sewing room with creepy dress form mannequins. Rey holds her shotgun toward the door, expecting Benjamin to follow them. Tori - every dial turned on - leads Reyes into a walk-in closet. She opens a door at the other end of the closet and comes on —

dialogues.speaker: A GUEST BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Faded wallpaper, oval mirror, religious statuettes on the dresser. No sign of Benjamin anywhere. The two women try not to move. The house eerily quiet. They listen. From elsewhere upstairs they hear, faintly - A floorboard CREAK. Reyes signals Tori to hide while she goes to investigate. Tori nods. Reyes heads out into the hallway - silently, steadily. Tori ducks into -

dialogues.speaker: HER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: She's alone now. She wedges herself under the bed.  93. She lies down. As low as possible. She can hear strange noises - odd floorboard creaks. BENJAMIN APPROACHES. Tori is frozen with fear. She retreats as far under the b she can. Benjamin enters the bedroom. Tori sees his FEET GLIDE PAST - A COUPLE INCHES OFF THE GROUND. She covers her mouth with both hands, trying not to give herself away. Benjamin moves on. BENJAMIN WALKS PAST WEARING HIS RED MASK AND CAPE. Just a feet away. Tori covers her mouth with both hands, trying not to give herself away. A heavy silence. Nothing moves. Tori cranes her head slightly, peaking out from under the She can see, IN THE REFLECTION OF A MIRROR - Reyes making her way down the hallway. Tori wants to tell she's in danger, but she can't. Benjamin INTERCEPTS HER — Reyes gets off a SHOTGUN BLAST but it glances off Benjami Tori can see in the mirror - Reyes HOWLS IN AGONY as Benj palms her face and SMASHES HER HEAD AGAINST THE WALL - HE

dialogues.speaker: SKULL SPLITTING LIKE A MELON. BLOOD SPLATTERING THE MIRRO
dialogues.text: It takes all of Tori's power not to scream. Benjamin stands in the hallway, his mask caked with blood dust. Inhuman. He listens. He HEARS SOMETHING coming from the bedroom - Someone under the bed. He ENTERS THE BEDROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crouches down and LOOKS UNDER THE BED. There's no one there. He looks to the bedroom closet. The door SLIGHTLY AJAR. He knows where Tori is. He goes to the closet door. He OPENS IT. No one there. Just shelves of towels and toiletries.

dialogues.speaker: TORI DANGLES FROM THE SECOND-STORY WINDOW.
dialogues.text: She looks down. It's a 25 foot drop. She has no choice. She lets go - And FALLS TO THE GROUND. HARD. Her ankle twisted, fucked. She wills herself to stand up. And takes off running. Into the backyard. Emergency lights from the sheriff's squad car swirl eeril the quiet night. Tori limps toward the cornfield - her ankle ringing with She presses on. Running. Frantic. She tears through the thick stalks of corn. Desperate. And then she hears it - Behind her, faintly - A TWO-TONE SING-SONG WHISTLE. The same from the game of h and-seek earlier.  95. Tori wants to cry. Can't cry. She charges forward. She emerges from the cornfield. Headed toward the big barn. She runs across the patchy ground. Comes to -

dialogues.speaker: THE BIG BARN
dialogues.text: She bursts in through the entryway. The place creepy at n A dead, rotting husk of a building. Almost pitch black. Tori climbs up an old ladder. Straining.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The building RATTLES. Tori lets out a whimper. She can he Benjamin CRASHING HIS WAY INTO THE BARN. From behind her, closer this time, Tori hears -— THE TWO-TONE SING-SONG WHISTLE. She cries to herself -

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: No no no. Benjamin is stalking her. Toying with her. Tori inches her way along -

dialogues.speaker: A DARK WALKWAY
dialogues.text: She feels along the walls. Floorboards at her feet missing or rotting away.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Benjamin bursting through walls, literally tearing apart barn to find her. Tori steps further -

dialogues.speaker: AN ENTIRE SECTION OF THE BARN EXPLODES INWARD
dialogues.text: Tori's path is collapsed. Cut off.  96. She tries a different route. SHE CRAWLS UNDER A GAP at the base of the wall. She squeezes her way into -

dialogues.speaker: A HIDDEN STORAGE SPACE
dialogues.text: She stands up to find, lit by moonlight from gaps in the roof -

dialogues.speaker: MOTHS.
dialogues.text: And carved all over the wooden walls - BENJAMIN'S 'B' INSIGNIA. Over and over and over. Tori is lost, panicking, trapped. She feels a tremor - the whole barn shaking -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN BURSTS INTO THE STORAGE SPACE -
dialogues.text: Tori BACKS AWAY - STUMBLES - AND CRASHES THROUGH ROTTING FLOORBOARDS. She FALLS. TWO STORIES. AND LANDS HARD IN THE GRAIN PIT AREA. She's dazed. Her nose bleeding. Her back screaming with pain. She sees the rotting roof and the night sky above her, flittering with moths. She has to get up. She staggers to her feet. Scrambles to the TRAP DOOR. She strains to lift the HEAVY DOOR. From somewhere above hears the SING-SONG WHISTLE, getting closer.  97. She manages to lift the door. In the pit below lies the RUPTURED BLACK POD. She KICKS at the shell of the thing. The pod BREAKS INTO PIECES. She GRABS ONE OF THE SHARDS. Rises. And -

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Mom? Tori turns to see - Benjamin STANDING BEHIND HER. The two of them alone in the pit. Tori quivers, terrified. Benjamin slowly removes his mask. His young face is cold, distant. Tori is jittery. Trying to keep it together. Holding the at her side, concealed.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: Benjamin - listen to me - She steadies herself.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've never stopped loving you. Ever. I believe - I still believe - that you are a blessing that fell down to this Earth. Benjamin remains wary.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When we found you, you were so helpless. So tiny. All we could do is keep you safe. Benjamin's anger starts to dissipate.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No matter what you've done, you are still good inside. Benjamin breaks - a 12-year-old boy now, not a killer. He begins to cry. The most emotion we've seen from him.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I want to do good, Mom. I do.  98.

dialogues.speaker: TORI
dialogues.text: You will. I'll help you. Benjamin comes to her. He embraces her. Weeping. Burying his face in her shoulde Tori cries too. She holds him, stroking the back of his h She whispers -

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You will always, always be my baby boy. Tori TAKES THE BROKEN SHARD FROM HER SIDE - LIFTS IT - AB

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN'S HAND CATCHES HER WRIST.
dialogues.text: He stares into her eyes - a mixture of rage and wounded p He squeezes Tori's wrist. She drops the black shard. Terr for her life -

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No... No, Benjamin... BENJAMIN GRIPS HER TIGHTER. HE SURGES UPWARD.

dialogues.speaker: TORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Benjamin... BENJAMIN SURGES UPWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE FLIES HIGHER AND HIGHER —

dialogues.speaker: A TV NEWSCAST
dialogues.text: An ANCHORMAN sits at a local news desk. Over his shoulder graphic that reads DISASTER IN THE SKIES.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORMAN
dialogues.text: Breaking news this hour. A passenger jet has crashed in the small town of Brandenburg, Kansas. Reports are still coming in, but there are believed to be no survivors among the 268 passengers on board. We go now live to our own Dawn Maywell, at the scene of this horrific tragedy. Dawn, what can you tell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young reporter in a parka stands before the smoldering wreckage of a DOWNED PASSENGER JET, billowing smoke. She a microphone and speaks to a TV camera.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Investigators are not yet sure what caused the plane to drop suddenly from the sky. There was no inclement weather, no indications of engine failure... We PULL BACK to take in a grisly scene - Bodies scattered - on the ground, in a tree, hanging from ruptured fuselage. A zillion globe lights from emergency vehicles. Firefight spray water onto the wreckage. Rescue workers attend to t scene. PULL BACK further to realize we're on the grounds of the BREYER FAMILY FARM. The plane seemingly nosedived into th farmhouse itself. In the back of an EMT vehicle, sitting all alone, is BENJ wrapped in a mylar blanket.  100. He watches the billowing smoke, the swirling lights. He's emotionless. His aunt Merilee approaches him with a Dixie cup of water

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Here. I was able to get you this. She hands him the water. He drinks it.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I talked to one of the officials. They said you can go if you'd like. Benjamin looks up at her. His face passive. She gazes down at him with sympathy. She has trouble keep it together.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh Benjamin, I'm so sorry. She starts to weep.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All those people... your parents... dead. It's too much. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm just grateful you're okay.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE
dialogues.text: Come on — She helps him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: MERILEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll stay with me until we figure things out. The two of them walk away from the EMT vehicle. Benjamin reaches out and takes Merilee's hand. She clutches it. Merilee looks ahead. She doesn't see the faint SMILE cree across Benjamin's face.  101. They walk past the wreckage, leaving the tragic scene. The camera stays on the crash. It DOLLIES IN on the ruptured side of the airplane. There, seared into the wreckage is the STRANGE 'B' INSIGN BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: DURING END CREDITS
dialogues.text: We HEAR staticky audio from the cockpit of the plane -

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (casual) Tower, our engine instruments look good. Eighty knots, heading two six zero. (then) Winds are at zero one - um. Huh. We're seeing something downwind. Unidentified. Approaching.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We lost engines 3 and 4! Losing altitude! We can hear passengers SCREAMING - PIERCING - PRIMAL.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Something's outside the plane! A man... Oh my God... A boy... THEN A MASSIVE ERUPTION - A WALL OF STATIC. Come up on —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man in a navy tie and a pressed white shirt sits at a t in a small room holding a steaming cup of coffee. Let's c this man BLACK COFFEE. A charred orange Cockpit Voice Recorder is plugged into h laptop. The speakers hiss STATIC. Black Coffee rewinds the audio and plays the last part ag  102.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: - outside the plane! A man... Oh my God... A boy... He stops the recording. He sits back in his chair. Gears turning. The door opens. AGENT TWO - young, crisp, female - enters small room and hands him a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK COFFEE
dialogues.text: This about the South China Sea? As he scans the report -

dialogues.speaker: AGENT TWO
dialogues.text: Nine confirmed dead and counting.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK COFFEE
dialogues.text: We know what killed them yet?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT TWO
dialogues.text: Survivors tell stories of a half- man half-creature emerging from the ocean. Said to breathe underwater. Black Coffee takes a drink from his styrofoam cup. Then -

dialogues.speaker: BLACK COFFEE
dialogues.text: Sounds like we got another one. END.
